ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The films are great, but I'm not sure if it's worth going through the class to watch them. Get the syllabus though.

This was one of the classes I legitimately looked forward to attending. Discussion ranged from engaging to entertaining, which is a great spectrum to straddle, and the overall course felt organic. some people may not like such a liberal method of learning, but I personally enjoy the free-form nature of the course. I felt like I played a proactive role in my discussing of Black film as opposed to just memorizing facts and motifs.If you're a FILM STUDIES major, take it. If not, take it anyway. The films are also just fun to watch, in and out of their historical context.
